historySections.historySectionTitle: Calgary Filipino Methodist Church's Biblical, Historic, Protestant, Evangelical, and Revival Roots

events.description: Methodism traces its foundation from Jesus Christ through the first New Testament church in Jerusalem, Israel.
Carries on the Church Reformation's essential principles: sola scriptura, solus Christus, sola fide, sola gratia, and soli Deo gloria.
May 24, 1738: John Wesley experienced his 'heart strangely warmed' at Aldersgate Street, London, marking the beginning of Methodism as a revival movement.
April 2, 1739: John Wesley began field preaching, proclaiming 'glad tidings of salvation' to about three thousand people.
Wesley's ultimate goal for Methodism: 'To reform the nation and, in particular, the church; to spread scriptural holiness over the land.'

historySections.historySectionTitle: Early Methodism in America: Humble beginnings in America, 1760-1816

events.description: Began around 1760 with lay Methodists from Europe immigrating to America.
Key early leaders: Robert Strawbridge, Philip Embury, Barbara Heck, and Captain Thomas Webb.
John Wesley sent lay preachers, including Francis Asbury in 1771, who became a crucial figure.
Countercultural movement, anti-elitist and anti-slavery, appealing to African Americans and women.
Became the largest and most influential religious denomination in the United States in the early 19th century.
1766: Laurence Coughlan, a follower of Wesley, began preaching in Newfoundland.
1772-1775: Yorkshire settlers around Chignecto, Nova Scotia, brought their Methodist faith, leading to organized worship.
March 5, 1899: Bishop James M. Thoburn established a Methodist Episcopal Church mission in the Philippines, holding the first service at Teatro Filipino in Manila.
Captain Plummer became a main benefactor and founding member of what would become the Methodist Episcopal Church (Central Church).
Methodism spread throughout the Philippines and globally through overseas Filipino workers.
September 27, 1998: Rev. Rolando Vinluan established the first Filipino-Canadian Methodist Church, 'the Pacific Community Methodist Church,' in Winnipeg, Manitoba.
2008: Bro. Vincent and Sis. Melba Vinluan, with Rev. Jose Velasco, Jr., and Deaconess Teresita Velasco, opened the first Bible study for a Filipino Methodist church plant in Calgary.
December 25, 2014: Rev. Samson Ringor and pioneer believers planted the Edmonton Filipino Methodist Church (EFMC).
November 2017: Calgary Filipino Methodist Mission was first organized at the home of Rev. Jose Velasco, Jr., and Deaconess Tessie in Calgary.
August 18, 2018: Calgary Filipino Methodist Church (CFMC) was legally incorporated and registered as a charitable religious organization in Canada.
June 29, 2022: Rev. Jonavern Lungub joined CFMC as Administrative Pastor and Missionary.
May 23, 2023: Pastor Jonavern transferred his ordination credentials to the Global Methodist Church.
June 4, 2023: CFMC, in partnership with EFMC, helped plant Red Deer Filipino Methodist Church in Red Deer City, Alberta.
